download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

datainfo.documentation: Generic information on a data item

dataprovider.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

datainfo.dataprovider: Disjoint dataset obtained from auvessel.pro code 13thSept2013; Single limiter data from Patrick Mc Carthy (DivIIa,b,c,d files); vessel contours from Paddy Mc Carthy; filled by R. Coelho

putdate.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

source.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

datainfo.source: v3 PFC elements from auvessel.pro, inner/outer vessel from 17th Dec email from Paddy, the single limiter contours from various directories under /afs/ipp/u/pjm/ but chiefly SRC/HA/rmeas and SRC/HA/readb; v2 17th Dec email from Paddy ;v1 /afs/ipp/u/pjm/SRC/HA/rmeas/AUGVessCoords.dat
datainfo.comment: v3 - 3 wall2d included: first one is for equilibrium codes (single closed limiter contour and vessel), the second for gas-tight or particle codes (disjoint PFCs with inner vessel included as last limiter_unit; the vessel structure is empty) and the third is for free boundary codes (disjoint limiter units without the inner vessel included in the set + the vessel); v2 - The vessel thickness is generally 15 mm (uniform) with the exception of 16 bellows separating the sectors, and of course the many ports. The bellows are 1.5 mm thick and hence account for most of the toroidal resistance: 0.24 milliOhm out of a total R_toroidal of 0.28 milliOhm. The toroidal coverage of the 15mm-thick vessel wall is approx. 334/360 degrees. Note that the 24 degree coverage by the bellows is in their folded state. In reality they have a much longer "unfolded" length. ;v1 - vessel coordinates in 59 points, clockwise defined, last point is no longer replica of first point

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

wall2d.documentation: 2D wall descriptions; Array of structures (number of wall descriptions). Replicate this element for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, single contour limiter, disjoint gapped plasma facing components, ...). Time-dependent

wall_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of 2d wall you are using. Use 0 for single contour limiter and 1 for disjoint PFC structure like first wall.
wall_id.description: Single limiter PFC and the vessel. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

limiter.documentation: Description of the immobile limiting surface(s) or plasma facing components for defining the Last Closed Flux Surface. Two representations are admitted : single contour or disjoint PFC. The limiter_id identifies the type of limiter set and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nlimiter_type). Time-dependent

limiter_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of limiter you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single contour limiter and 1 for the official disjoint PFC structure like first wall. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2
limiter_id.description: Single limiter PFC and the vessel. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

limiter_unit.documentation: Vector of limiting surfaces. Replicate this limiter_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a plasma facing component that can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (ncomponents)

name.documentation: Name or description of the limiter_unit

limiter_unit.name: contour

closed.documentation: Identify whether the contour is closed (y) or open (n)

position.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a limiting surface. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

delta.documentation: Wall thickness [m] (Optional if a closed facing component is given but useful for simpler closed contour limiter); Time-dependent; Scalar

vessel.documentation: Mechanical structure of the vacuum vessel. Vessel assumed as set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or blocks. The vessel_id identifies the type of vessel_unit set one is using and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nvessel_type)

vessel_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of vessel you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single/multiple annular vessel and 1 for the official block element representation for each vessel unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2
vessel_id.description: Single limiter PFC and the vessel. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

vessel_unit.documentation: Vector of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

annular.documentation: Vector of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

name.documentation: Name or description of the vessel_unit

annular.name: contour

inside.documentation: Inner Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_inner)

outside.documentation: Outer Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_inner)

blocks.documentation: Vector of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

blocks_unit.documentation: Vector of blocks that build of the vessel layer. Replicate this element nblocks times. Each unit contains a building block of the vessel and can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (nblocks)

name.documentation: Name or description of the blocks_unit

blocks_unit.name: Put value here

position.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a vessel segment. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

eta.documentation: Resistivity of the vessel segment [ohm.m]; Scalar

wall2d.documentation: 2D wall descriptions; Array of structures (number of wall descriptions). Replicate this element for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, single contour limiter, disjoint gapped plasma facing components, ...). Time-dependent

wall_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of 2d wall you are using. Use 0 for single contour limiter and 1 for disjoint PFC structure like first wall.
wall_id.description: Disjoint set of limiter PFC including the inner vessel as limiting structure. No vessel is included. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

limiter.documentation: Description of the immobile limiting surface(s) or plasma facing components for defining the Last Closed Flux Surface. Two representations are admitted : single contour or disjoint PFC. The limiter_id identifies the type of limiter set and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nlimiter_type). Time-dependent

limiter_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of limiter you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single contour limiter and 1 for the official disjoint PFC structure like first wall. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2
limiter_id.description: Disjoint set of limiter PFC including the inner vessel as limiting structure. No vessel is included. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

limiter_unit.documentation: Vector of limiting surfaces. Replicate this limiter_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a plasma facing component that can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (ncomponents)

name.documentation: Name or description of the limiter_unit

limiter_unit.name: tile

closed.documentation: Identify whether the contour is closed (y) or open (n)

position.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a limiting surface. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

delta.documentation: Wall thickness [m] (Optional if a closed facing component is given but useful for simpler closed contour limiter); Time-dependent; Scalar

limiter_unit.documentation: Vector of limiting surfaces. Replicate this limiter_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a plasma facing component that can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (ncomponents)

vessel.documentation: Mechanical structure of the vacuum vessel. Vessel assumed as set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or blocks. The vessel_id identifies the type of vessel_unit set one is using and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nvessel_type)

vessel_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of vessel you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single/multiple annular vessel and 1 for the official block element representation for each vessel unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2
vessel_id.description: Disjoint set of limiter PFC (inner vessel not included) and the vessel. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

vessel_unit.documentation: Vector of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

annular.documentation: Vector of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

name.documentation: Name or description of the vessel_unit

annular.name: contour

inside.documentation: Inner Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_inner)

outside.documentation: Outer Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_inner)

blocks.documentation: Vector of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

blocks_unit.documentation: Vector of blocks that build of the vessel layer. Replicate this element nblocks times. Each unit contains a building block of the vessel and can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (nblocks)

name.documentation: Name or description of the blocks_unit

blocks_unit.name: Put value here

position.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a vessel segment. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

eta.documentation: Resistivity of the vessel segment [ohm.m]; Scalar
